title: Feeling blessed at Peaceful Gurudwara
review: Gurudwara Sahib is located on the main road and it is a beautiful white Marble building.It is very neat and clean like all Gurudwaras,we paid our homage and got the prasad. The gurudwara is pretty large and beautifully made and It's nicely maintained. There were sevadars who led us to the langar hall and we had tasty langar(free kitchen for all).  Pushkar is well known for the lake and Brahma Temple,Gurudwara Sahib is a must visit place.It is a historical place associated with Guru Nanaks and Guru Gobind Singh ji's Visit.

title: See the guru
review: The temple is on my view the most beautiful one in Pushkar. To go in, you need to cover your head but they provide bandannas free of charge. Inside the temple is a friendly guru meditating. However, inside the temple you are not allowed to take pictures.

title: Wahe Guru
review: Although Pushkar is more famous for Brama temple and lake, this place is a must visit. This offers a beautiful calm holy ambience. I am a fan of Langar and have great respect to the sevadar so.....

title: Beautiful Temple
review: A must to visit while in Pushkar. Easy to locate on the main road. Take pictures of the outside. No pictures from within, ony memories to take away.

title: Religious and calm place to visit
review: We every time visit this temple, because of serene beauty and calm and peaceful place. Photographs are prohibited from inside. Place were you can get inner peace. Must visit place in Pushkar.

title: peaceful vibe
review: huge structure and they served a free food for every devotee and people at this temple very kind space for parking also

title: Sikh Gurus visited this place
review: Guru Nanak Dev ji visited Pushkar, because this was one of the major sites for performing last rites and priests used to cheat locals.  Guru ji gave his own thoughts on such social evils and saved poor from getting robbed.

title: Nice Gurudwara in Pushkar
review: We visited late in the evening, and they were closing down, but allowed us to go inside; the temple is nice and clean, and the sikhs are very hospitable as always. However, they do close I believe by 8PM, so better to visit earlier in the day. Nice, clean and serene place. You do have to cover your head, and women also have to cover their arms/shoulders. The head coverings are available free for all. You are also required to clean your feet using the small pool of water before going up the stairs; and remove shoes.

title: Very clean place of worship!
review: Visisted with my taxi driver and took my breath away.  Well kept and very peaceful.  Nicely maintained.

title: Very clean and spiritual
review: A beaut and clean place of worship   It is a bit away from town but is worth visiting if you are passing

title: Beautiful gurudwara
review: The gurudwara is pretty large and beautifully made. The white marble building itself is pretty new, having replaced the old gurudwara buiilding. It's nicely maintained.

title: Peaceful and Beautiful Sikh Temple
review: We very much enjoyed visiting this Gurudwara --- the architecture is spectacular and it was great to take a moment for a peaceful prayer.

title: One of the sacred places of Sikh community
review: Gurdwara Singh Sabha is one of the sacred places for sikh community. Visit to Gurdwada will refresh your mind and soul.

title: located when you enter a city center of pushkar
review: The heritage style structure sikh temple they offer a free food to every traveler and they are very polite people who manage a sikh temple.

title: Peace | Tasty & Healthy Food
review: We visited the Gurudwara twice on our trip. It is centrally located on the Main Market Road and has the largest area in terms of all other religious places around. Very Beautiful and peaceful. Do try the Langar (Free Kitchen) which serves delicious free food for anyone - no discrimination.

title: Pushkar Gurdwara
review: A neat and clean place which gives you instant peace of mind as soon as you enter. Head cover is important

title: A Real Spiritual Place
review: Although Pushkar is known for Brahma Temple and Pushkar Lake,but this place is really worth a visit...

title: Very clean and spiritual
review: A beaut and clean place of worship   It is a bit away from town but is worth visiting if you are passing

title: A beautiful setting
review: This is a quiet, majestic setting in a busy and active city setting.  Take a walk around the grounds and inside to appreciate the emotional strength of this temple.

title: Pop in while you're walking by
review: The temple is 200 metres from the beginning of the main market area.  It's impressive from the outside but a basic example of a temple on the inside.  An interesting diversion while you're walking by, but really nothing special compared to the many other incredible temples in Pushkar and the rest of the Rajasthan region.
